summary: The Community College Educational Exchange Act aims to foster educational exchanges, primarily focusing on international scholars and experts studying at U.S. junior or community colleges and postsecondary vocational institutions. It tasks the Secretary of State and the Administrator of USAID with strengthening partnerships, expanding exchange programs (including scholarships) in key development sectors, and building the capacity of eligible institutions to offer study abroad programs. The bill defines key terms, outlines reporting requirements to Congress, and specifies the sectors of focus for exchange programming.
